ga
Class Chromosome

java.lang.Object
  ga.Chromosome
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Chromosome
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

A Chromosome acted upon by the GA, an Agent contains a LinkedList of these ojects as its "genome". The Chromosome is a wrapper around a LinkedList of Genes.

Author:
Matt Oates
See Also:
Gene, Agent

public void mutate(double probability)
Attempt to mutate each gene in the chromosome, both the gene phenotype and default level of expression will be effected.

Parameters:
probability - The probability of succesfully mutating each gene.

mutate

public void mutate(double probAllele,
                   double probGene)
Attempt to mutate each gene in the chromosome, both the gene phenotype and default level of expression will be effected. The reason to do these seperately is that promotion and supression of the genes expresssion is specific to the allele value and not the penotype. So the balance of expression within a chromosome can evolve seperately from the specific phenotype. You still want to do both since a different expression level might be better suited to a specific phenotype.

Parameters:
probAllele - The probability of succesfully mutating the allele or default level of expression for each gene.
probGene - The probability of succesfully mutating the gene phenotype.
